text: thumbnail thumbnail thumbnail thumbnail thumbnail thumbnail thumbnail Dimorphocalyx glabellus var. lawianus (Hook.f.) Chakrab. & N.P.Balakr. is a tree endemic to South India in semi-evergreen forests. Flowering is from February–October and fruiting is from November–January. As in all species of Dimorphocalyx, flowers are dieocious. ==References== Category:Codiaeae Category:Flora of India (region)
title: Dimorphocalyx glabellus var. lawianus
